briefdescription.para: Loose relation, related elements are not part of the parent and a parent copy will not copy any children.
Fix relation, related elements are part of the parent and a parent copy will copy any children or delete of parent will delete children.
enum for the relation strength Association, Composition
Default constructor.
Copies a relation.

detaileddescription.para: This makes a shallow copy, relations are implicitly shared and only duplicated when the copy is changed.

briefdescription.para: Add a field pairs which is part of this relation The first element of each pair are the field names of the foreign key.

detaileddescription.para: The second element of each pair are the field names of the matching primary key.

parameterdescription.para: The field name on the referencing (child) layer (FK)
The field name on the referenced (parent) layer (PK)

briefdescription.para: Add a field pairs which is part of this relation The first element of each pair are the field names of the foreign key.

detaileddescription.para: The second element of each pair are the field names of the matching primary key.

briefdescription.para: Returns the field pairs which form this relation The first element of each pair are the field names of the foreign key.

detaileddescription.para: The second element of each pair are the field names of the matching primary key.

briefdescription.para: Generate a (project-wide) unique id for this relation.
Creates a request to return the feature on the referenced (parent) layer which is referenced by the provided feature.

parameterdescription.para: A feature from the referencing (child) layer

briefdescription.para: Creates a request to return the feature on the referenced (parent) layer which is referenced by the provided feature.

parameterdescription.para: An attribute vector containing the foreign key

briefdescription.para: Creates a request to return the feature on the referenced (parent) layer which is referenced by the provided feature.

parameterdescription.para: A feature from the referencing (child) layer

briefdescription.para: Creates an iterator which returns all the features on the referencing (child) layer which have a foreign key pointing to the provided feature.

parameterdescription.para: A feature from the referenced (parent) layer

simplesect.para: An iterator with all the referenced features

briefdescription.para: Returns a filter expression which returns all the features on the referencing (child) layer which have a foreign key pointing to the provided feature.

parameterdescription.para: A feature from the referenced (parent) layer

simplesect.para: expression filter string for all the referencing features

briefdescription.para: Creates a request to return all the features on the referencing (child) layer which have a foreign key pointing to the provided feature.

parameterdescription.para: A feature from the referenced (parent) layer

simplesect.para: A request for all the referencing features

briefdescription.para: Compares the two QgsRelation, ignoring the name and the ID.
A (project-wide) unique id for this relation.
Returns the validity of this relation.

detaileddescription.para: Don't use the information if it's not valid. A relation is considered valid if both referenced and referencig layers are valid.

simplesect.para: true if the relation is valid

briefdescription.para: Returns a human readable name for this relation.

detaileddescription.para: Mostly used as title for the children.

briefdescription.para: Copies a relation.

detaileddescription.para: This makes a shallow copy, relations are implicitly shared and only duplicated when the copy is changed.

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of attributes used to form the referenced fields (most likely primary key) on the referenced (parent) layer.
Access the referenced (parent) layer.
Access the referenced (parent) layer's id.

simplesect.para: The id of the referenced layer

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of attributes used to form the referencing fields (foreign key) on the referencing (child) layer.
Access the referencing (child) layer This is the layer which has the field(s) which point to another layer.
Access the referencing (child) layer's id This is the layer which has the field(s) which point to another layer.

simplesect.para: The id of the referencing layer

briefdescription.para: Gets the referenced field counterpart given a referencing field.
Gets the referencing field counterpart given a referenced field.
Set an id for this relation.
Set a name for this relation.
Set the referenced (parent) layer id.

detaileddescription.para: This layer will be searched in the registry.

briefdescription.para: Set the referencing (child) layer id.

detaileddescription.para: This layer will be searched in the registry.

briefdescription.para: Set a strength for this relation.
Returns the relation strength as a string.
Updates the validity status of this relation.

detaileddescription.para: Will be called internally whenever a member is changed.

briefdescription.para: Writes a relation to an XML structure.

parameterdescription.para: The parent node in which the relation will be created
The document in which the relation will be saved

briefdescription.para: Creates a relation from an XML structure.
